entry.title: Bumpless pipe dreams encode Gr√∂bner geometry of Schubert polynomials
entry.summary: In their study of infinite flag varieties, Lam, Lee, and Shimozono (2021) introduced bumpless pipe dreams in a new combinatorial formula for double Schubert polynomials. These polynomials are the $T \times T$-equivariant cohomology classes of matrix Schubert varieties and of their flat degenerations. Hamaker, Pechenik, and Weigandt (2020) conjectured that bumpless pipe dreams index the irreducible components of diagonal Gr\"obner degenerations of matrix Schubert varieties, counted with scheme-theoretic multiplicity. We prove this conjecture, as well as a generalization to equidimensional unions of matrix Schubert varieties. This result establishes that bumpless pipe dreams are dual to and as geometrically natural as classical pipe dreams, for which an analogous anti-diagonal theory was developed by Knutson and Miller (2005).
